page.title: 03Cantley in the Past.
page.content: {Cantley}was an important area to the {Romans}because of the pottery kilns which were sited in the area.The remains of many kilns have been discovered and pieces of pottery can still be found in gardens today. The{Saxons}settled in the area under the leadership of a chief called Canta.Their settlement was in a clearing and the small village which developed became known as{Cantaleia. This was mentioned in the original Domesday Book with Bessacarr being referred to as a marshy stretch of land.St.Wilfred's church is one of the oldest in the Doncaster area being built originally of wood and thatch before the{Normans}invasion.Later this was replaced by a stone church however the present building dates from the beginning of this century.
